turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Fast Masters.
turn.1: What is the difference between Fast Masters and older drivers?
turn.2: Fast Masters Fast Masters was a made-for-television auto racing series, broadcast on ESPN in 1993, featuring notable drivers over the age of 50, most of whom were retired from professional racing at the time.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The Fast Masters series was a summer-long elimination competition, with identically-prepared, $750,000, TWR, Jaguar XJ220s racing on Bridgestone RE71 high-performance street tires.
turn.6: The races took place under-the-lights at Indianapolis Raceway Park, in conjunction with ESPN's "Saturday Night Thunder".
turn.7: What else is significant about this?
turn.8: The cars carried the sponsorship of Havoline, and the series was officially sanctioned by USAC.
turn.9: Was anyone else apart of it?
turn.10: Close and intense racing ruled each night as championship winning veterans from Formula One, IndyCar, NASCAR, NHRA, Endurance racing and more, including some who were well into their 70's, fought hard for every position.
turn.12: The series quickly gained a reputation for unabashed hard driving, and multiple heavy crashes that severely damaged, or even totaled, multiple machines.
